fixes.name: Profit Margin %
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the row-level Tableau expression [Profit Ratio ]*100 to a DAX calculated column by multiplying the 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Ratio ] by 100. This is a row-level transformation, so it's implemented as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Revenue Tier
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
  'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Net Revenue ] > 1000,
  "High Margin",
  IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Margin %] > 10,
    "Medium Margin",
    "Low Margin"
  )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the Tableau IF/ELSEIF logic into nested DAX IF statements. References to row-level fields were converted to 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Column]. This is row-level logic, so implemented as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Quality Score
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
  'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Margin %] > 15 &&
  'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Heavy Loss Check ] = "Normal",
  IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Revenue Tier] = "High", 5, 4),
  2
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IIF and nested IIF to DAX IF with logical AND (&&). All column references were transformed to the 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Column] format. This uses only row-level fields and comparisons, so it is a calculated column.
